items.title: "Were I a Bird."
Charleston - Earthquake damage - Business - Roper Hospital, side view
items.description: 2 contact sheets, 1 print; 20 x 12.5; Cracks in building and broken windows. Taken from ground level.

items.title: Charleston - Church - Grace Episcopal Church - Pinnacled Spire. Test negative, f -stop (same as #25)
items.description: 2 contact sheets; 10 x 12.5; Test shots from rooftop. On paper glued to negative: Stanley Plate No. 35 Anthony single [illeg.] Exposure 1/2, 1, 1 1/2 secs. Pyro and Salsoda [Saleoda?] devel. Sep. 4 Pm '91. Smallest stop

items.title: Charleston - Residence - John Steinmeyer House, 108 Beaufain St.
items.description: 4 contact sheets, 4 prints; 20.5 x 12.5; Same as #70 but from further away.

items.title: Charleston - Business - Roper Hospital (right section) Queen and Mazyck Sts. Facing Queen St.
items.description: 2 contact sheets, 1 print; 20.5 x 12.5; Partially destroyed tower (two-story with wooden eaves) is on far left. On right side at corner of building is a four-story tower. Each piazza arch frames a door or window.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - 35 Coming St. Corner of Coming and Montagu Sts.
items.description: 4 contact sheets; 10 x 12.5; Smaller, darker close-up of #52.

items.title: Charleston - Church - Enston Home Chapel, 900 King St.
items.description: 1 contact sheet; 10 x 12.5; Almost same as #19 and #20, but angled so that iron cross atop bell tower is visible.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - Frederick Heinz House and Ice Cream Parlor, 387 King St., Corner of King and South Battery
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 1 print; 20.5 x 12.5; 3-story tower with conical roof on right corner of house. Wrought iron fence. Ice cream parlor small and long. Though it is separate building, it has same address as house in 1894 City Directory.  Francis Marion Hotel now stands on this site.

items.title: Charleston - Church - Grace Episcopal Church Steeple, f-stop test (same as #25)
items.description: 1 contact sheet; 10.5 x 12.5; Test shots from rooftop. On paper glued to negative: [illeg.] Plate No.35 [illeg.] Wide Angle. Exposure 1/2, 1, 1 1/2 secs. Pyro and Salsoda [saleoda?] devel. Sep. 15 4pm '91

items.title: Charleston - Miscellaneous - Rooftops and Harbor - negative image (same as #92)
items.description: 3 contact sheets, 1 print; 10.5 x 8.5; Same as #92, but negative image.

items.title: Charleston - Business - O.G. Marjenhoff Bakery, 149 & 151 Church St. (Also visible Wm. Mohring Grocery and Saloon, 153 Church St.)
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 1 print; 17.5 x 12.5; Two inset entrances with display windows on either side. Windows on second and third floors separated by fluted pilasters with Corinthian capitals. Friezes above the second and third floors. Brick fence. Rounded pediment - like structure with O G Marjenhoff 1887 * 1887 carved on it.  Two-story building and three-story brick building behind bakery. To the right: William Mohring grocery and saloon at 153 Church St. Photo taken from second floor.

items.title: Charleston - Miscellaneous - Lime Pit near Charleston
items.description: 2 contact sheets, 4 prints; 25 x 20; Lime Pit near Charleston written on negative. Photo taken from inside pit. Two men carrying shovels and wearing aprons lend perspective to size of pit. Observation tower; two smokestacks. People standing by railing at pit edge.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - 35 Coming St. Corner of Coming and Montagu Sts.
items.description: 4 contact sheets; 18 x 12.5; Queen Anne style house with square tower, first floor bay window, and closed gable with patterned wood. Fences extend from back of house. Wrought iron fence along Coming St. Wood fence along Montagu St.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - Gaillard-Bennett House, 60 Montagu St. Corner of Montagu and Gadsden Sts.
items.description: 3 contact sheets, 1 print; 16 x 10.5; Dual stairway leading to main entrance with stone balustrade bordering either side of stairs. Wrought iron garden gate. Anthony's single lens medium stop written on original envelope.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - John Ravenel House, #5 East Battery (Also visible: #9 Robert William Roper House
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 1 print; 20 x 12.5; Paved walk of East Battery. Water to right. To left is #5 John Ravenel House, three-story stone house with two-story piazza overlooking garden. Italianate style entablature and lintels added after the earthquake. Also visible is #9 Robert William Roper House, Greek Revival style.

items.title: Charleston - Earthquake damage - Residence - 118 Tradd St. Corner of Tradd, Legare, and Friend Sts.
items.description: 2 contact sheets; 12.5 x 10; Much of wall facing Friend St. gone.  A loose window frame on side facing Tradd St. Furniture still in house and exposed to weather. Two boys, probably African-American stand inside first floor.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - William Enston Home, 900 King St. between Congress and Romney Streets
items.description: 1 contact sheets, 2 prints; 20.5 x 12.5; Row of 5 identical houses, but photo is of poorer quality.

items.title: Charleston - Church - St. Philip's Episcopal Church - Interior from the balcony, 144-146 Church St.
items.description: 2 contact sheets; 18 x 12.5; Taken from rear balcony, better view of side balconies and side windows as well as side arches.

items.title: Charleston? Residence
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 1 print; 20.5 x 12.5; Three-story projected bay windows facing street. Balcony around roof. Wrought iron fence with stone pillars at the wooden gate

items.title: Charleston - Church - Grace Episcopal Church - Pinnacled spire
items.description: 3 contact sheets; 12.5 x 10; Taken from rooftop.

items.title: Charleston - Fort Moultrie - Lighthouse Harbor
items.description: 2 contact sheets, 1 print; 20 x 12.5; Lighthouse sitting amongst sand dunes. Brick wall behind it. Low hills in background.

items.title: Charleston - Business - Kohn, Furchgott, and Benedict, Dry Goods, 259 King St. Negative #2
items.description: 1 contact sheet; 12.5 x 20; Left shade raised half way up; right shade lowered. Less is visible of #261.

items.title: Charleston - Miscellaneous - Horse-Drawn Fire Engine
items.description: 14 x 8.5; Fire engine drawn by two bay horses. Eight African-American firemen in uniform are riding on it.

items.title: Charleston - Business - Roper Hospital (center section) Queen and Mazyck Sts. Facing Queen St.
items.description: 2 contact sheets, 1 print; 20.5 x 12.5; Center structure was probably framed by two square towers each four stories. The right one extends to the second floor and then is covered by wooden eaves. Wrought iron fence. Street lamp. Some wings were demolished in 1886 but main block survived.

items.title: Charleston - Church - St. Philip's Episcopal Church - Interior, 144-146 Church St.
items.description: 2 contact sheets; 18 x 13; From ground level, facing altar, showing pews, balconies on either side, fluted columns with ornate capitals and rounded arches between columns. Church is rounded behind altar with stained glass windows and carved dome ceiling over altar.

items.title: Charleston - Business - Roper Hospital (left section) Queen and Mazyck Sts. Facing Queen St.
items.description: 3 contact sheets, 1 print; 20.5 x 12.5; Four-story tower at corner on left. Four-story tower on left of center structure. Each piazza arch frames a door or window.

items.title: Charleston - Miscellaneous - Lake - West End Lake, later Colonial Lake? 4 April 1889
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 2 prints; 20 x 12.5; Sidewalk on the left. Buildings in the background. Boats and people on the lake. Cracked emulsion.

items.title: Charleston - Church - Mt. Zion AME Church Tower
items.description: 4 contact sheets; 12.5 x 10; Taken from rooftop. Top of tower no longer exists. Poston believes exterior has been preserved in its original form. This photo clearly refutes that. Poston quotes Albert Simons, early twentieth century architectural historian, regarding inspiration for sarcophagus terminus. However, sarcophagus-like part was not originally the terminus.

items.title: Charleston - Church - St. Philip's Episcopal Church - Interior, 144-146 Church St.
items.description: 3 contact sheets; 18 x 12.5; Same as #35, but better of stained glass.

items.title: Charleston - Earthquake damage - Business - Roper Hospital, back, right side
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 2 prints; 20 x 12.5; Cracks in building and broken windows. Taken from second floor.

items.title: Charleston? Residence
items.description: 2 contact sheets; 16.5 x 10.5; Taken from garden and showing pentagonal shaped room on end with dormer windows. Garden has ornamental urn, shrubbery, and street lamp. Garden path edged with stone.

items.title: Charleston - Earthquake damage - Business - Roper Hospital, side view
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 1 print; 20 x 12.5; Cracks in building and broken windows. Taken from ground level.

items.title: Charleston - Earthquake damage - street scene
items.description: 12.5 x 10; Demolished and severely damaged buildings. Taken from second or third floor.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - William Enston Home, 900 King St. between Congress and Romney Streets
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 1 print; 20.5 x 12.5; Row of 3 identical house and houses visible behind them.

items.title: Charleston - Church - Grace Episcopal Church - Pinnacled spire with scaffolding . Test negative, f -stop
items.description: 2 contact sheets; 13 x 10; Test shots from rooftop.  Four different exposure times. 1 sec., 2 secs., 3 secs., and 4 secs., scratched on negative.

items.title: Charleston - Business - German Fusiliers Armory, 1775-1888, and Old Fire Station, 66 Wentworth St. (Also visible 64-70 Wentworth)
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 3 prints; 20.5 x 12.5; Double-door entrance with rounded arch. Large windows on either side with double window in center of second floor with a window on each side. Has pediment. Above the first floor is carved German Fusiliers in the center. On the left is carved 1775 and on the right 1888. Labeled as Old Fire Station on the 1888 Sanborn map. #64 Wentworth is two-story brick dwelling with two-story piazza facing street. To left is #68-70, a three-story single house with basement and two-story piazza facing garden. #70 was residence of Jacob Livingston, undertaker. Photo taken from second floor.

items.title: Charleston - Business - City Hospital, 5-19 Lucas St. Corner of Lucas and Calhoun Sts.
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 3 prints; 20.5 x 12.5; Slightly I-shaped building with numerous evenly spaced windows overlooking both streets. Main entrance apparently on second floor with dual staircase leading up to it. Labeled as new on the 1888 Sanborn map.

items.title: Charleston - Miscellaneous - South Battery
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 1 print; 20 x 12.5; Taken from White Point Garden. Houses along South Battery obscured by trees. Horse and wagon in street. Park benches, street lamp.

items.title: Charleston - Church - Enston Home Chapel, 900 King St.
items.description: 2 contact sheets, 2 prints; 12.5 x 20; Same as #19. Lot has been recently cleared. Photo has cracked emulsion.

items.title: Charleston - Business - Kohn, Furchgott, and Benedict, Dry Goods, 259 King St. Negative #1
items.description: 12.5 x 20; Inset entrance between shaded display windows. Left shade reads Kohn, Furchgott, & Benedict 259 Dry Goods. Right shade similar with Carpets instead of Dry Goods. Bowed windows above entrance. Ornate wood carvings. 1887 carved in pediment. Man standing at open third floor window on left. Street is brick. Only small portion of 257 King St., S. Thomas & Bro., Jewelers, is visible. Clock reflection in upstairs windows shows 5:40. Small alley with door separates #259 from #261. Part of proprietor's name is visible D.Vogt. The advertising sign in front of store reads Oswego Deep Rock Water [illeg.] Try It.

items.title: Charleston - Earthquake damage - Residence - Single house on South Battery next to William Gibbes House
items.description: 2 contact sheets, 1 print; 20 x 12.5; Same as #45, but from a different angle so earthquake damage is not visible.

items.title: Charleston - Fort Moultrie
items.description: 2 contact sheets, 1 print; 20 x 12.5; Wall of fort. Gate in middle of wall. Taken from a road.

items.title: Charleston - Miscellaneous - Cemetery and Oak Tree - Magnolia Cemetery on Meeting St.?
items.description: 2 contact sheets, 4 prints; 20 x 12.5; Large oak tree with Spanish moss. Cemetery in background. One original envelope ws labelled No.3 April 4, 1889 Magnolia . . .

items.title: Charleston - Church - The Huguenot Church - Interior, 136-140 Church St.
items.description: 2 contact sheets; 20 x 12.5; Negative severely damaged by cracked emulsion. Taken from left side of church. Gothic arches, organ pipes above altar. Chandelier over aisle.

items.title: Charleston - Church - Enston Home Chapel, 900 King St.
items.description: 2 contact sheets; 10 x 12.5; Stone arches over windows and square bell tower projecting from one corner. Houses in background.

items.title: Charleston - Church - St. Matthew's German Lutheran Church steeple
items.description: 2 contact sheets; 10.5 x 12.5; Taken from a tall building looking out over rooftops. Steeple in center.

items.title: Charleston - Miscellaneous - Cemetery and Oak Tree - Magnolia Cemetery on Meeting St.?
items.description: 2 contact sheets; 20 x 12.5; Same as #78.

items.title: Charleston - Fort Moultrie
items.description: 3 contact sheets, 6 prints; 20 x 12.5; Two boys standing near a picket fence in the sand. Brick wall and church steeple in background.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - William Enston Home, 900 King St. between Congress and Romney Streets
items.description: 1 contact sheet; 20.5 x 12.5; Row of five identical house, but taken at a shorter distance than #57.

items.title: Charleston - Earthquake damage - Church - Unitarian Church, 6 Archdale St. (Also visible St. John's Lutheran Church, 10 Archdale)
items.description: 2 contact sheets, 3 prints; 12.5 x 10; Top of steeple of Unitarian Church gone. To right of church is the cemetery concealed by trees and surrounded by wooden slat fence. To left is St. John's Lutheran Church with no visible damage. Telephone pole and street lamp.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - Mayor William Ashmead Courtenay House, 95 Ashley Ave. Corner of Ashley and Montagu Sts.
items.description: 2 contact sheets, 1 print; 16.5 x 10.5; Greek Revival single house with two-story projecting bay windows added after 1886 earthquake (Poston p.467-488). Dormer windows.

items.title: Charleston - Business - illegible print on negative. Looks like Langist Shops Drop Chulty Morrison
items.description: 2 contact sheets; 10 x 13; One-story building has three wide entrances and dirt yard surrounded by split-rail fence. Could be a stable? Two-story building is perpendicular to it. Behind these are one-story clapboard building, three-story brick house with three-story piazza facing garden, and four-story stone building. Photo taken from third floor.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - Charles Henry Drayton House, 25 East Battery. Corner of East Battery and Atlantic
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 1 print; 17.5 x 12.5; Single house built between 1883 and 1886 (Poston p.222) Protruding entranceway. Attic windows have balconies. Decorative ironwork on top of house. Wrought iron fence around garden.

items.title: Charleston - Earthquake damage - Residence - William Ravenel House, 13 East Battery
items.description: 4 contact sheets; 12.5 x 10; According to Poston, a two-story portico with Tower of the Winds Corinthian columns came down in the earthquake. Remains of portico are lying on the sidewalk and in the street. Part of the roof is missing in the rear. Wood slat fence in perfect condition as is street lamp. Scaffolding may be in place in far left. African-American man in front.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - William Enston Home, 900 King St. between Congress and Romney Streets
items.description: 2 contact sheets; 20.5 x 12.5; Two and half of a third identical house.

items.title: Charleston - Business - Von Oven Bros. Wholesale and Retail Grocers, 276 King St. Corner of King and Wentworth Sts. (Also visible 270-288 King St.)
items.description: 3 contact sheets, 3 prints; 13 x 10; Despite fact that building has 298 on it, address must be 276. 298 King is not on corner according to 1888 Sanborn map, but 276 is. Also, 276 is listed as address for Von Oven in 1886 and 1892 City Directories. Building to left appears to be same building pictured next to 274-276 King St (now Commercial Savings Bank Building) in Poston. Sign out front reads Charleston Tea & Coffee Emporium, Von Oven. Between 2nd & 3rd floors Selected Teas, Coffees, & Spices, Fine Segars, Liquors, & Cordials. Across Wentworth is Greek Revival style Masonic Temple (#270-274). On left of Von Oven's: #278 vacant; #280 shop; #282 shop; #284 Samuel H. Wilson, wholesale grocer & importer of teas; #286-288 Charles Elias & Co. dry goods. Also telephone poles and street lamps. Taken from 2nd or 3rd floor.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - Isaiah Jenkins Mikell House, 94 Rutledge Ave. Residence of Mayor John F. Ficken
items.description: 2 contact sheets, 2 prints; 20.5 x 12.5; Neo-classical style resembles an Italian villa. Center of photo is Rutledge Ave. bordered by wood fence with stone pillars. Trees line inside of fence.  (Poston p.556)  Later housed Charleston Free Library.

items.title: Charleston - Miscellaneous - Classroom /astronomy lab.     4 Oct. 1886
items.description: 1 contact sheet; 12.5 x 10; Chairs, tables with astronomical instruments, chart showing transits of Venus, globe, chalkboard with Oct. 4, 1886 written on it. Photo damaged by cracked emulsion. Probably College of Charleston since they had a professor of astronomy, mechanics, physics, and chemistry, Lewis R. Gibbes, M.D., listed in City Directory

items.title: Charleston? Residence (same as #75)
items.description: 1 contact sheet; 17.5 x 12.5; Same as #75 except taken from across street. Wrought iron garden fence. Two-story brick house on right with brick wall behind it. Tree guards on edge of street. Wide sidewalk. Street appears to be cobbled or bricked.

items.title: Charleston - Miscellaneous - Cemetery and Oak Tree - Magnolia Cemetery on Meeting St.?
items.description: 3 contact sheets; 20 x 12.5; Same as #78.

items.title: Charleston - Business - Central Fire Station, 260-264 Meeting St. Corner of Meeting and Wentworth
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 2 prints; 20 x 12.5; Nearly identical to #1.

items.title: Charleston - Earthquake damage - Business - Roper Hospital, back, center
items.description: 4 contact sheets, 1 print; 20 x 12.5; Cracks in building and broken windows. Taken from second floor.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - S.C. Menke artist / tailor, 62 Broad, and Oscar S. Miscally, plumber, 60 Broad.  Earlier and later the Confederate Home, 60-64 Broad St. (Also visible 58 Broad St.)
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 2 prints; 18 x 13; S.C. Menke's sign is more easily read on negative. Oscar Miscally's sign needs magnification. Confederate Home at 60-62 Broad in both 1886 and 1892 City Directories. Poston identifies this building as the Confederate Home, 60-62 Broad. Second Empire style with mansard slate roof and pressed metal dormers (5 across front) and cornices. Two wrought-iron balconies overlooking street on second floor. Three entrances on first floor. First and second floor extension on left overlooking stone-walled garden. Repaired after earthquake. 58 Broad also visible: three-story stone building with second story balcony, two dormer windows. Streetcar tracks, street lamp, brick street.

items.title: Charleston - Earthquake damage - Business - Roper Hospital, back, left side
items.description: 2 contact sheets, 1 print; 20 x 12.5; Cracks in building and broken windows. Taken from second floor.

items.title: Charleston - Miscellaneous - Rooftops and Harbor
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 2 large print; 16.5 x 11; Facing east, taken from St. Phillip's Episcopal Church. Building slightly down and left of center has L. W. Bicaise Gun and Lock Works on side, at 22 - 24 State St. Large long building on left is F.W. Wagener and Co. Wholesale Grocers, 161-165 East Bay, and it stretches from East Bay to State St. along Queen St.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - Valk House, 125 Broad St. Corner of Broad and Legare Sts.
items.description: 2 contact sheets; 17.5 x 12.5; Broad St. side: covered entranceway, bay window on second floor with three narrow windows below, to left a long narrow window stretching two floors. Woodwork around attic windows. Brick and wrought iron fence. Telephone pole, tree guards, and streetcar tracks on Broad St. Built by Charles R. Valk of Valk and Murdoch Iron Co. in late 1880s

items.title: Charleston - Residence and Street, probably South Battery
items.description: 2 contact sheets, 3 prints; 20.5 x 12.5; Bay windows on side with balcony above. Balcony on roof overlooks street. Dark pilasters at corners. Woodwork extends several feet below roof. Wrought iron fence around garden. To left is two-story brick building, two three-story clapboard houses, and two-story house. Street lamp three houses down.

items.title: Charleston - Church - Grace Episcopal Church - Pinnacled Spire. Test negative, f -stop (same as #25)
items.description: 1 contact sheet; 16.5 x 11; Test shots from rooftop. On paper glued to negative: 1/2, 1, 1 1/2 secs. 3 P.m. Aug 3 '91  Carbutts B. No. 15  Smallest stop pencilled over.

items.title: Charleston - Church - Grace Episcopal Church - Interior, 100 Wentworth St.
items.description: 1 contact sheet; 18 x 13; Facing altar, Gothic stained glass windows and Gothic arches over the center and side aisles. Row of columns on each side supporting Gothic arches.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - Laurens-Rutledge House, 117 Broad St. Corner of Broad and Orange Sts.
items.description: 1 contact sheet; 17.5 x 12.5; Projecting bay windows on first floor behind balustrade on either side of entrance. Balcony above. Tower on left corner. Oval lights in center gable. Stone fence on Orange St. side. Wrought iron fence on Broad St. side. Telephone pole. Streetcar tracks on Broad St. House built in 1760s as a Georgian double house. Bought by Frederick Wagener in 1885 who added the west wing. (Poston p.206-7)

items.title: Charleston - Miscellaneous - Lake - West End Lake, later Colonial Lake?
items.description: 2 contact sheets; 20.5 x 12.5; Taken from bridge or sidewalk beside body of water. Sidewalk extends past water. Trees along other bank with large house behind them. Different angle from #99.

items.title: Charleston - Church - Grace Episcopal Church - Interior, 100 Wentworth St. (same as #23)
items.description: 1 contact sheet; 17.5 x 12.5; Same as #23.

items.title: Charleston - Miscellaneous - Horse-Drawn Fire Engine and T.B. Anderson Building Material warehouse
items.description: 1 contact sheet; 14 x 8.5; Fire engine drawn by two bay horses (in motion). Eight African-American firemen in uniform are riding on it. One on sidewalk in front of clapboard building labeled Coal. In background is a one-story brick building labeled T.B. Anderson Building Material. T.B. Anderson listed in City directories as clerk. His residence is 4 Lucas Street, but doesn't look like a residence.

items.title: Charleston - Business - Central Police Station, 406-410 King St. and Marion Square
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 1 print; 20.5 x 12.5; Castle-like fa�ade. Plain with numerous evenly spaced windows. Building new in 1887. At intersection of King and Hutson, but Hutson not visible. Buildings to left of station barely visible. King St. has cobbles and streetcar tracks. Some cracked emulsion.

items.title: Charleston - Business - Palace Shaving Saloon and Israel Ottolengui, Auctioneer and Real Estate Agent, 40 and 38 Broad St. (48 - 36 Broad St. visible)
items.description: 2 prints; 13 x 10; Row of businesses on north side of Broad St. Center of photo is #40 Palace Shaving Saloon owned by Fridie and Nesbit and #38 Israel Ottolengui, Auctioneer and Real Estate. To right, # 36 is designated shop on Sanborn's 1888 map. Left of center: #42 Hibernian Savings Institute; #44 Wm. Hastie & Son, insurance agents and brokers; #46 and #48 are Klinck, Wickenberg, & Co. grocers. Photo taken from the second or third floor of building across the street.

items.title: Charleston - Church - Grace Episcopal Church - Pinnacled Spire. Test negative, f -stop (same as #25)
items.description: 1 contact sheet; 16.5 x 11; Test shots from rooftop. On paper glued to negative: [illeg.] B. Plate No. 15 Morrison Wide Angle. Exposure 1/2, 1, 1 1/2, 2 secs. Pyro and Salsoda [Saleoda?] Devel. Sep.4 pm '91 [illeg.]

items.title: Charleston - Church - Mt. Zion AME Church Tower test shot
items.description: 1 contact sheet; 10 x 12.5; Test shot. Same as #32.

items.title: Charleston - Miscellaneous - Horse-Drawn Fire Engine  (same as #83)
items.description: 3 contact sheets; 14 x 8.5; Same as #83, only horses are in motion and further down the street.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - John Steinmeyer House, 108 Beaufain St.
items.description: 2 contact sheets, 2 prints; 16.5 x 11; House obscured by palmetto trees behind a wrought iron fence. Street lamp and telephone pole in left foreground.  (Poston p. 493)

items.title: Charleston - Miscellaneous - Harbor
items.description: 2 contact sheets; 20 x 12.5; Canons retrieved from the harbor piled beside the water.

items.title: Charleston - Business - Central Police Station, 406-410 King St. and Marion Square  (same as #48)
items.description: 3 contact sheets; 20.5 x 12.5; Identical to #3. Also has cracked emulsion.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - Laurens-Rutledge House, 117 Broad St. Corner of Broad and Orange Sts.
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 2 prints; 20 x 12.5; Different angle from #65. Piazza now visible. Streetcar tracks.

items.title: Charleston - Residence and Street.  South Battery?
items.description: 2 contact sheets, 1 print; 20 x 13; Single house with apparently flat roof. Resembles Nathaniel Russell Middleton House, 22 South Battery, minus pediment. Wooden garden fence. Wrought iron fence to right. Street lamp in front.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - Drayton Hall and 2 side buildings
items.description: 1 contact sheet; 20.5 x 12.5; Dual staircase leading to main entrance. Four white Ionic columns across the middle with pediment above. Two plain brick two-story buildings on either side with few windows.

items.title: Charleston - Business - Central Fire Station, 260-264 Meeting St. Corner of Meeting and Wentworth
items.description: 1 contact sheet; 20 x 12.5; Two buildings perpendicular to one another and joined at corner forming courtyard with domed pavilion over artesian well in middle. Restrained Italianate Revival style with brick detailing. Two entrances facing street on each building for steamer and hose carts. Building constructed 1887-1888. Meeting St. cobble-stoned with streetcar tracks and telephone poles. Photo taken from second floor of opposite corner.

items.title: Charleston - Business - Kohn, Furchgott, and Benedict, Dry Goods, 259 King St. Negative #3
items.description: 12.5 x 20; Both shades up. Man at open third floor window to left. Clock on #257 reads approximately 5:43. Only initials of proprietor of #261 are visible.

items.title: Charleston - Miscellaneous - Horse-Drawn Fire Engine
items.description: 1 contact sheet; 14 x 8.5; Fire engine drawn by two white horses with nine African-American firemen in uniform sitting on it. Building has two wide entrances.

items.title: Charleston - Residence - Joseph Glover House, 90 Ashley Ave.
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 1 print; 16.5 x 10.5; Renovated by Toale family c.1881-1890 (Poston p.486) 1886 City Directory does not show Toales living there. Queen Anne style changes: semicircular bay window, patterned triangular panel in top of gable. Photo taken from garden.

items.title: Charleston - Earthquake damage - Residence - Single house on South Battery next to William Gibbes House
items.description: 2 contact sheets; 20.5 x 12.5; Damaged house has all nine visible windows shuttered. Octagonal structure off back with cracks in the stone and from which stonework is falling. One wall appears to lean outward. Gibbes House has dual staircase leading to front door with pediment. Gated garden or alley separates houses

items.title: Charleston - Residence - William Enston Home, 900 King St. between Congress and Romney Streets
items.description: 2 contact sheets, 1 print; 20.5 x 12.5; Row of 5 identical L-shaped houses. Covered entranceway with stone arches and also stone arches over windows on either side of entrance. Newly cleared yard. Home for sick and of good character between 45 and 75. Built ca.1887. Designed by W.B.W. Howe.

items.title: Charleston - Miscellaneous - Shipyard and Boxcars
items.description: 2 prints; 20 x 12.5; Two railroad tracks with three boxcars sitting on one. Shipyard beside marsh. City on horizon. Photo taken from elevation.

items.title: Charleston - Business - Otto Tiedeman & Sons, Wholesale Grocers and Provisions, 172 - 176 East Bay. Corner of East Bay and Accommodation Wharf
items.description: 1 contact sheet, 2 prints; 18 x 12.5; #174-176 has two inset entrances with display windows between them. On top of building is arch with Tiedeman 1887. #172 is also Tiedeman's. Telephone pole and horse and cart in street.

items.title: Charleston - Church - Enston Home Chapel - Interior, 900 King St.
items.description: 2 contact sheets; 20 x 12; Unfurnished. All dark wood interior with support beams for pitched roof visible. Memorial statue and plaque for William Enston. Marred by light from windows.

items.title: Wrapt in its folds Our Whole Country shines respondent through its Stars.
Jeff uses Virginia as a cat's paw.
The Union Constitution Liberty and Laws!!
Cease Viper, you bite a file.
Sly-Fox Scott taking Jeff Monkey's Last Trump
The Innocent Cause of all the trouble.
[Jefferson Davis, John Bull and Yankee Doodle]
The Union Game Cock and Secession Shanghae
One of the F.F.V's after his Contraband.
The End of Rebellion-a painful Tail.
[Confederate general preparing to meet General McClellan]
The Tomb and Shade of Ellsworth.
Star Of The North, Or The Comet of 1861
Capt. Thomas' new position in the Naval Bureau
The persuasive eloquence of the Sunny South.
Gen. Scott killing the Secession Hydra
Only One Flag And One Government
J. D. putting his best foot foremost.
The Strong Arm of the North
Liberty And Union Now And Forever

items.location: Whar is Massa Jeff now, dat's what's de matter.
items.title: The latest Contraband of War.
